docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON-A few years ago, medical scientists in Helsinki injected rubella vaccine into 35 pregnant women who were scheduled to have abortions. The doctors wanted to find out what effect the live virus in the vaccine would have on the fetuses.
docs.abstract: Comment on current med controversy that questions ethical use of live, aborted fetuses for research purposes; illus
docs.snippet: WASHINGTON-A few years ago, medical scientists in Helsinki injected rubella vaccine into 35 pregnant women who were scheduled to have abortions. The doctors wanted to find out what effect the live virus in the vaccine would have on the fetuses.
